title: 114_hr108
content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the curr_chunk cannot be summarized. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code, terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, with no further contributions or deductions allowed. Prior rights are not affected, and eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unchanged. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress. Eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress under the Federal Employees' Retirement System. Eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. Section 8425a of Title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, with no further contributions or deductions allowed after a certain period. Eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Section 8425a of Title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress after a certain period, with no further contributions allowed. This does not affect any prior rights, entitlements, or benefits under the chapter. Eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations may be implemented as needed. The Thrift Savings Plan participation is governed by regulations set by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in Title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
